episodes.content: A creator from Hokkaido Prefecture, Japan who specializes in rhythmical animation with illustrations and figures that move to music. He was commissioned by the Foundation for Ainu Culture to create an animation about the Ainu. The purpose of the foundation is to preserve the stories and myths passed down orally by the non-literate Ainu through music, language and animation. This episode explores the appeal of Ishiguro's portrayal of the Ainu culture, which has slowly been disappearing year by year.
episodes.description: A creator from Hokkaido, Japan who specializes in rhythmical animation about the Ainu. We explore Ishiguro's portrayal of the indigenous culture, which has slowly been disappearing year by year.
episodes.subtitle: Portraying Ethnic Lore Through Animation
episodes.title: Anime Supernova

episodes.content: Mainly works as a director on live-action commercials. At 43, he began working on original stop-motion animated works. In addition to writing and directing, he also works with art, animation, puppet-modeling and more. He's a nature-loving Akita Prefecture-born creator who currently lives in Karuizawa. He aims to create textured visuals unique only to stop-motion animation.
episodes.description: Yashiro began creating stop-motion films at 43 while working as a CM director. The nature-loving Akita-born creator currently lives in Karuizawa, also working with art, puppet-modeling, and more.
episodes.subtitle: A Stop-Motion Fantasy Full of Nature
episodes.title: Anime Supernova

episodes.content: The up-and-coming creator has made the cover art for various novels, created music videos, and put together image boards for animated shows, all while attending university. Okada has gained the attention of international animation fans because of the detailed, beautiful worlds he creates and his ability to tell a story in every single cut. Watch and find out why the animation world has high expectations for this young 20-something creator.
episodes.description: Up-and-coming student creator Okada Shogo is known for his wide variety of work and detailed, beautiful worlds. Find out why the animation world has high expectations for this young artist.
episodes.subtitle: A Student Creator With a Bright Future
episodes.title: Anime Supernova

episodes.content: Coming from a live-action film background, Iwaisawa is almost entirely self-taught in animation production. He continues to move up in the animation world and separate himself from other animators through self-developed techniques. Iwaisawa specializes in rotoscope, an animation technique that is based on tracing over live-action footage. The painstaking work leads to highly detailed images that come to life in ways not seen in traditional animation. We will introduce you to the one-of-a-kind, internationally-acclaimed world of Iwaisawa Kenji.
episodes.description: Iwaisawa Kenji is a self-taught creator who uses a technique called rotoscoping to produce one-of-a-kind animated works. Watch and get lost in the fantastical worlds of a visionary creator.
episodes.subtitle: Aiming for an Academy Award! A Creator Taking on Unprecedented Challenges
episodes.title: Anime Supernova

episodes.content: Tomioka currently heads the 3DCG studio Canavan Graphics. His job encompasses directing, writing and producing, all while managing his company. The talented creator is well-known for his original comedic animation style. He has also turned his original characters into multi-faceted businesses that include goods, video games and other ventures. In this episode, we find out what drives Tomioka's creativity and how he has become a master of comical 3DCG animation.
episodes.description: Tomioka Satoshi is a director, writer, producer, and CEO known for his unique comedic style and multi-faceted business ventures. Watch and find out how this renaissance man mastered 3DCG animation.
episodes.subtitle: A Master of Comical 3DCG Animation
episodes.title: Anime Supernova
